content.description:
This is the best climb on the cliff. It is sustained and varied with excellent rock and movement. Extend some pieces to avoid rope drag.

Start at a giant flake thing that is protruding from the wall. I climbed the right side of it, but it might also be possible to start on the left. Climb the crack through a series of bulges to reach the final arching splitter. This section has great position as the cliff drops away just a few feet below you. Don't get tunnel vision here and look around for other features besides the finger crack. Pull through one last bulge to the top.

The guidebook says it has a piton anchor. We found one piton which can be backed up by gear. To descend, scramble right on 3rd/easy 4th class

to the bolted anchors above Bob-Bob-a-Ramp. Rappel with one 60m rope.
content.protection: Pro to 2" with some extra finger size cams.

content.description: Splitter line with obvious crux. Starts out splitter ends splitter! Gets a bit punchy through the bulge but protects well and is just a couple moves!
content.protection: Single cammers & widgets will do to 3” but if you are a stud like a myself doubles to 4”!
content.location:
Up hill and left on the SW face. A little bush wacky to get to but well worth it. Starts with 5.8 OW BP.

Gear anchor, find rappel via down climbing to either Bob a Ramp or new bolted anchor atop Spiral Staircase.

content.description:
Spiral Staircase starts out ok at best but after some initial moves and a dirty airy traverse, you do gain a stellar double hand crack that is quite fun and does have cool positioning.

Great access line to gain the tops of some of the harder climbs.
content.protection: Single set of SLCD from 1/2-2”! You may want your rack of chocks and hexcentricks but I would imagine that to be personal preference/stylistic. One thing is for certain you might want to extend every piece at least 18cm to avoid this rope drag phenomenon since the route does go at a bit of a spiral!
content.location:
Start just left of SM on short OW to gain the traverse ledge. Traverse used to be weird to protect especially the follower until the tree but now there is a lead bolt.

Nice two bolt anchor with rap rings 20’ up and right from where double crack ends on a good ledge.

content.description:
This is one of the better climbs at Wild Rose. A nice, straight-in jam crack for 100 ft. The base is also easy to access without all the thorn bushes.

The size varies from fingers to hands and is sort of flared (reminds me of cracks in Joshua Tree). It's pretty sustained but has some good rest spots.
Traversing crux climbing around arete to cracks & arete, exposed and steep.
content.protection: 6 bolts, pro to 1", 2 bolt anchor with mussy hooks, 60m rope needed to lower.
content.location: The obvious white dike traversing right from Bobcrack to the main arete of the formation.

content.description: Climb Bob-Bob-a-Ramp, then cut right at a straight-in crack.
content.protection: Gear to 2". Gear anchor, then scramble up and left to fixed anchors on Bob-Bob-a-Ramp.
content.location: Right of Ass Pin, start in the dihedral of Bob-Bob-a-Ramp.

climbs.name: Bob-Bob-a-Ramp
climbs.fa: Tony Puppo, Paul Brown, Dave Field (early '80s)

content.description:
This is sort of in the middle of the South Face. It takes the obvious corner between Ass Pin and Over & Out.

Make a bouldery start over some rose bushes. Scramble up some easy terrain to reach a fun steep bulge. Above, climb the awesome right facing corner with some tricky liebacking near the top.

Rap with one 60m rope.

content.protection: 5 bolts, optional pro thin-1.25", 2 bolt anchor with mussy hooks.
content.location: Just left of the initial dihedral of Bobcrack and Bob-bob-a-ramp.
